description: As of March 16,  on territory of Republic of Serbia ,,there will be no schools, kindergartens, faculties starting tomorrow, and students will study via television''. It is unlikely that school will open by the end of the school year.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)

description:
As of March 16,  on territory of Republic of Serbia ,,there will be no schools... and students will study via television''. It is unlikely that school will open by the end of the school year.

May 15
Furthermore, the Ministry of Education, Science and Technological Development informed higher education institutions in Serbia that they can start with practical and laboratory exercises, starting from May, 15, 2020.

description: Mar. 15 ,, --- President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar Vucic announced tonight that due to the coronavirus situation, a decision was made to declare a state of emergency throughout the Republic of Serbia.''

Mar. 15 ,, --- President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar Vucic announced tonight that due to the coronavirus situation, a decision was made to declare a state of emergency throughout the Republic of Serbia.''
May 6 - "The Serbian parliament lifted tonight the state of emergency that was declared on 15 March over the coronavirus epidemic." UPDATE: The Serbian parliament lifted tonight (May 6) the state of emergency that was declared on 15 March over the coronavirus epidemic.

Mar. 15 ,, --- President of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar Vucic announced tonight that due to the coronavirus situation, a decision was made to declare a state of emergency throughout the Republic of Serbia.''

May 6 - "The Serbian parliament lifted tonight (May 6) the state of emergency that was declared on 15 March over the coronavirus epidemic"

As of March 10, ,,a temporary ban on entry into Serbia for foreign nationals coming from the areas with intense corona virus transmission is introduced. This applies to persons coming from Italy, certain provinces of the People’s Republic of China, South Korea, Iran and parts of Switzerland.''
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
As of March 10, ,,a temporary ban on entry into Serbia for foreign nationals coming from the areas with intense corona virus transmission is introduced. This applies to persons coming from Italy, certain provinces of the People’s Republic of China, South Korea, Iran and parts of Switzerland.''
End on March 15th when the Declaration of Emergency was announced; "The country’s Prime Minister Ana Brnabić confirmed that Serbia’s borders would be closed to all foreigners “tonight” (Sunday), apart from diplomats and full-time residents." UPDATE: "The country’s Prime Minister Ana Brnabić confirmed that Serbia’s borders would be closed to all foreigners “tonight” (March 15th Sunday), apart from diplomats and full-time residents."
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Mar. 12-- ,,The Serbian government passed a decision today on the closure of border crossings, as one of the new measures to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

44 border crossings for road, rail and river traffic to Hungary, Romania, Bulgaria, Montenegro, Croatia, Northern Macedonia and Bosnia-Herzegovina have been temporarily closed.''
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Serbian government decided to turn the Belgrade Exhibition Hall into a makeshift Hospital (3 000 beds). The Serbian Army has called up 60 members of the reserve forces to Belgrade and Novi Sad to assist with preparations to fight the coronavirus outbreak (e.g. non-medical tasks in military- medical institutions). As of 23 April, a new hospital has been opened in Karaburma with 60 beds for the treatment of patients with moderate and severe COVID-19 infections
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Serbia, as of 10:00 on Wednesday (March 18), all persons over 65 in urban areas and over 70 in towns with less than 5000 inhabitants are forbidden from leaving their homes. Local authorities will bring food to the affected individuals and special hours at shops might be allocated to the elderly in order to purchase necessary items.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 8, Prime Minister Ana Brnabic announced that a full weekend curfew will be enforced across Serbia starting on Friday, April 10, to curb the spread of the ongoing coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak. The curfew will be in place from 17:00 (local time) on Fridays to 05:00 on Mondays.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Serbia’s president announced a new curfew Tuesday that begins Friday at 5 p.m. that will last until 5 a.m. Tuesday local time (15:00GMT to 03:00GMT) during the Easter weekend for Orthodox Christians.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 13th, 2020, the government of Republic of Serbia has established The Crisis Response Team. The team was formed at the session to eliminate the emerging and prevent the possible harmful consequences of COVID-19 infectious disease in the economy.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: As of 11th of March, ,,regarding the service facilities located on the transit route through Serbia and the motorways, it was decided that the employees must wear protective equipment when coming in contact with transit passengers.''
type_text: Regarding the service facilities located on the transit route through Serbia and the motorways, it was decided that the employees must wear protective equipment when coming in contact with transit passengers.

description: On 13th of March, the Serbian government has ,,approved a 10% increase in salaries for health care workers and health care providers starting 1 April.''
type_text: Government has approved a 10% increase in salaries for health care workers and health care providers.

description: On 13th of March, Government of Republic of Serbia has made decision to to,, pay all pensioners one-off financial assistance in the amount of RSD 4,000. Retirement payouts will start on 15 April.''

As of 11th of March, it has been decided that starting from the following day, ,,every day at 18.00 the Ministry of Health and epidemiological services will inform citizens about the state of coronavirus in Serbia.''

As of March 15th, ,,the government of the Republic of Serbia has established a single contact centre "COVID-19" at number 19819. By calling this number, citizens can get advice and recommendations from experts in the fight against coronavirus and contact competent professional services throughout country.''
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On Mar. 11 the government of Serbia ,,passed the Decision preventing indoor public gatherings, with public gathering being defined as a gathering in a closed room with more than 100 people''
